subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative damage and a vicious cycle of mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging.
Emphasizes accumulation of mtDNA mutations leading to increased ROS and a damaging feedback loop causing mitochondrial decline.
Describes ROS production causing mtDNA damage and mutation accumulation, leading to mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.
Details mitochondrial ROS generation and the balance of ROS detoxification affecting oxidative damage and aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative damage and a vicious cycle of mitochondrial impairment.
Highlights ROS-induced mtDNA mutation feedback loop and somatic mtDNA mutations as drivers of aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, mtDNA mutations, and oxidative damage as causes of aging.
Describes mitochondrial ROS production, mtDNA mutations, bioenergetic decline, and inflammation driving aging.
Links mitochondrial ROS-induced damage accumulation and mutation rates to longevity and aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative damage and a vicious cycle contributing to aging.
Describes accumulation of mitochondrial oxidative damage, ROS vicious cycle, impaired energetics, and apoptosis in aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage accumulation, and impaired mitochondrial quality control.
Highlights mitochondrial ROS production, sex differences in oxidative stress, and oxidative damage driving aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production causing cumulative oxidative damage and correlation with lifespan.
Describes ROS-induced mtDNA mutations causing a vicious cycle that drives mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.
Emphasizes accumulation of mtDNA mutations, mitochondrial dysfunction, and structural damage as aging drivers.
Focuses on mitochondrial ultrastructural changes, ROS production, and oxidative damage as causal in aging.
Describes mitochondrial ROS production, mtDNA damage accumulation, and functional impairment leading to aging.
Focuses on ROS-induced mtDNA damage, mutation accumulation, and age-related decline in mitochondrial DNA repair.
Links mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS production, oxidative damage, and synaptic impairment in aging.
Although focused on mitohormesis, it centers on mitochondrial ROS as signaling molecules affecting aging and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on PINK1-PARK2-mediated mitophagy regulating mitochondrial quality, cell fate, and aging-associated pulmonary disorders.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction causing ATP shortage that impairs lysosomal acidification and autophagic clearance, linking mitochondrial and lysosomal dysfunction.
Focuses on coordination of nuclear and mitochondrial gene expression for respiratory chain function and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Neuroinflammation Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes bidirectional feedback between mitochondrial dysfunction and microglial activation driving neuroinflammation and aging.
Proposes mitochondrial energetic and topological properties as central drivers of aging, linking bioenergetics, molecular entropy, and aging biomarkers.
